Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals in their natural environments, including the fish and other animals that live in water.
The student can identify and describe the resources that plants and animals need to survive, such as water, air, and land resources like rocks and soil.
The student can show and explain how the fish and other organisms use water in their habitat to swim and live.
The student can demonstrate and label other relationships between living things and their environments, like how plants need sunlight and water to grow.
The student can illustrate how fish live in water, which is part of their habitat system, showing how these parts work together to meet their needs.
